results.title: Conquest of the sea
results.brief_description: An exploration of the world under the water by aqua-lung divers near Adelaide in South Australia. This film shows glimpses of the unsurpassed beauty of underwater exploration, including sponges, red mullet, rock flathead, cowries, leather jackets and coral fish with long, narrow snouts. Wreck remains show that nature still challenges man.

results.title: Conquest of the rivers
results.creator_credit: H Malcolm and Snowy Mountains Authority
results.brief_description: Shows through the experiences of a new recruit to the Snowy Mountains Scheme how this great enterprise was carried out. There are dramatic scenes from inside the thirty-seven mile tunnel which is an essential feature of the work. Other views include the blasting of roads, dam-building, and the life of families in the new frontier towns of the Australian Alps. Uses archival footage.

results.title: Conquest of the dark
results.creator_credit: Douglas Clarke, Howard Thomas and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: Through the story of one man who loses his sight and who, with expert and sympathetic training, finds self-confidence and financial independence, the film illustrates the work which organised welfare of the blind is doing in Britain. It emphasises that in selected occupations the blind person can compete on terms of equality with the sighted, and shows many aspects of industrial rehabilitation.

results.title: Conquest of Everest
results.creator_credit: Grahame Tharp, Leon Clore, John Taylor, Group 3 and Countrymen Productions
results.brief_description: A record of the successful Everest expedition in 1953. Beginning with a brief account of earlier expeditions, this film shows the months of preparation, the arrival of the expedition party in Nepal, the hiring of the sherpas in Katmandu, the progress from one camp to another and the final assault by Hillary and Tenzing. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Conquest of a germ
results.creator_credit: John Eldridge, Donald Taylor and Gryphon Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatised tribute to the medical profession and, in particular, to the research workers whose efforts have produced so many valuable drugs and remedies which have revolutionised the treatment of pneumonia, child-birth fever, meningitis, and other diseases. Stars David Farrar.

results.title: Conquest
results.creator_credit: Harold L. Gray, Charles F. Banks, Rural Bank of New South Wales and Reelcraft Productions
results.brief_description: A rural bank manager and his new recruit on horseback visit a grazier who tells the story of claiming the land only to then suffer a drought causing loss to most of his stock. However his bank came to the rescue, providing him with enough money to carry on and buy new stock and equipment. A promotional film for the Rural Bank of New South Wales. Narrated by W. Lane-Bayliff
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harold L. Gray, Charles F. Banks, Rural Bank of New South Wales and Reelcraft Productions

results.title: Conquering the continent
results.creator_credit: Kelvin Hogarth and Outback Explorers Video Productions
results.brief_description: As Burke and Wills lay dying at Cooper Creek, a determined Scotsman was already planning his third transcontinental expedition. John McDouall Stuart had explored much of South Australia and penetrated to the very centre of Australia. His perseverance paid off when, on 24th July 1862, he finally reached the Indian Ocean. Stuart had succeeded in discovering a reliable route right across the continent. Upon reading of Stuart’s explorations, a father and his three young children were inspired to head off and attempt to retrace Stuart’s last and greatest expedition. With the children helping to operate the camera, they brought back a pictorial record of Stuart’s country as it is today. The story begins as an historical narrative but soon becomes a great Outback adventure. They enter isolated country seldom visited these days. It took them six weeks to do what had taken Stuart fourteen months to do as they covered the 12,000km return journey along Stuart’s route.

results.title: Conquerant de L'inutile = Borders of the Impossible
results.brief_description:
This documentary tells the life story of Lionel Terray who became one of the most famous French mountaineer after World War II. The footage used in this documentary has been filmed by friends and fellow mountaineers like Maurice Herzog and Jacques Ertaud. It contains breathtaking scenes of expeditions conducted by Terray in the Himalayas and the Andes.

Credits: Director, Marcel Ichac ; music, Francois de Roubaix.

results.title: Connie the cow: a curious butterfly
results.creator_credit: Josep Viciana, Cristina Brandner and Neptuno Films
results.brief_description: Join Connie the Cow, the very curious cow, in six colourful animated adventures. We all know that Connie loves to explore, make new friends and play. She is young and very mischievous. Every morning she wakes to explore the farm with her friends and brings about some exciting adventures. Music by Josep Roig.
